unit_learning_outcomes.description: Analyse definitions of constructs used in education research
Understand how to develop a researchable question for a systematic review
Prepare the basics of a systematic review in preparation for writing a full review
Apply an established quality analysis procedure to a set of research articles
Demonstrate knowledge of advanced database searches required for systematic reviews

assessments.description: A 2,000 word assignment includes documenting advanced database searching and decisions for including and excluding documents.
A 2,000 word advanced summary, extracting information from the articles using and applying an established quality analysis regarding the design of the studies.
2,000 words covering research area, background literature and aims leading to the research questions will be covered in this assignment.
A 6000 word final report involves integration of the previous assignment including response to feedback and other refinements.

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 2, Intensive attendance, North Ryde
Session 2, Infrequent attendance, North Ryde
data.subject_search_title: EDUC7001 - Introduction to Systematic Reviews in Education
data.description: Students will be introduced to the process of writing a systematic review and other methods of systematic research synthesis. Students will select an area of education research that is of interest and develop a systematic review. Areas of education research that may be examined in this unit include; early childhood education and care, primary and secondary schools, higher education, educational institutions such as museums, professional development, community education programs.
data.search_title: EDUC7001 - Introduction to Systematic Reviews in Education
